quotes.quote: Ignoring a child's disrespect is the surest guarantee that it will continue.
If they disrespect you to your face imagine what they're doing behind your back.
The only cure for contempt is counter-contempt.
Contempt for happiness is usually contempt for other people's happiness, and is an elegant disguise for hatred of the human race.
Contempt is the weapon of the weak and a defense against one's own despised and unwanted feelings.
Only the contemptible fear contempt.
Contempt mates well with pity.
Contempt is the only way to triumph over calumny.
Our contempt for others proves nothing but the illiberality and narrowness of our own views.
No matter what the reason, if you start to scream and shout, you look a fool, and you feel a fool, and you earn the disrespect of everyone.
Disrespect cannot be commanded, it must be earned.
Never make excuses for someone who disrespects you-who they are or what they do isn't a pass to treat you like trash!
You don't have permission to disrespect yourself.
You don't have to disrespect and insult others simply to hold your own ground. If you do, that shows how shaky your own position is.
Of all afflictions, the worst is self-contempt.
There is no respect for others without humility in one's self.
If we have no respect for our viewers, then how can we have any respect for ourselves and what we do?
When people don't respect one another seldom is there honesty.
An excess of courtesy is discourtesy.

Discourtesy does not spring merely from one bad quality, but from several--from foolish vanity, from ignorance of what is due to others, from indolence, from stupidity, from distraction of thought, from contempt of others, from jealousy.
A little rudeness and disrespect can elevate a meaningless interaction to a battle of wills and add drama to an otherwise dull day.
Impudence is the worst of all human diseases.
The way to avoid the imputation of impudence is not to be ashamed of what we do, but never to do what we aught to be ashamed of.
There is nothing more imprudent than excessive prudence.
I completely scorn the falsifying, the sanctimonious, the cheap and the shoddy.
There cannot be greater rudeness than to interrupt another in the current of his discourse.
Rudeness is the weak man's imitation of strength.
Straightforwardness, without the rules of propriety, becomes rudeness.
A true and genuine impudence is ever the effect of ignorance, without the least sense of it.
The way to avoid the imputation of impudence is not to be ashamed of what we do, but never to do what we ought to be ashamed of.
The insolence of time is like a blow in the face from an unseen enemy.
The insolence of the vulgar is in proportion to their ignorance. They treat everything with contempt which they do not understand.
There is an insolence which none but those who themselves deserve contempt can bestow, and those only who deserve no contempt can bear.
Mistaking insolence for freedom has always been the hallmark of the slave.
The insolence of authority is endeavoring to substitute money for ideas.
Surfeit begets insolence, when prosperity comes to a bad man.
Incivility is the extreme of pride; it is built on the contempt of mankind.
If the disagreement was strong enough, we could end up pretty close to the borderline of incivility.
The insolence of wealth will creep out.
Only once in my life was I on the edge of incivility. I do not like to be unkind.
In many people it is already an impertinence to say 'I'.
Impertinence will intermeddle in things in which it has no concern, showing a want of breeding, or, more commonly, a spirit of sheer impudence.
No one is more insufferable than he who lacks basic courtesy.
That bad manners are so prevalent in the world is the fault of good manners.
Bad manners make a journalist.
There is no excuse for bad manners, except fast reflexes.
There is no nobility with bad manners.
If you can't ignore an insult, top it; if you can't top it, laugh it off; and if you can't laugh it off, it's probably deserved.
Where there is no respect for life, there you will find evil.
Never insult anyone by accident.
To injure, ignore, disrespect, and violate the innocence of a child are among the greatest evils known to man.
Rudeness in old men is considered a sign of vitality. In fact, it is quite the opposite. It springs from shrunken sympathies.
Don't talk of rudeness. We have done with civility. We are to be as rude as we please.
I intend discourtesy to no one.
Contempt is the only way to triumph over calumny.
It is often more necessary to conceal contempt than resentment. The former being never forgiven, but the latter sometimes forgot. Wrongs are often forgiven; contempt never.
And every man hath a sting, which he may if provoked too far, dart out at one time or another.
I have unlearned contempt.— It is a sin that is engendered earliest in the soul, and doth beseth it like a poison-worm, feeding on all its beauty.
The basest and meanest of all human beings are generally the most forward to despise others.— So that the most contemptible are generally the most contemptuous.
Christ saw much in this world to weep over, and much to pray over; but he saw nothing in it to look upon with contempt.
Speak with contempt of in man.—Everyone hath a tender sense of reputation.
Contempt—like malice is the gauntlet thrown down by the female. Unlike menace, however, it shames rather than arouses the bad boy in a guy.
There is nothing which a person will not sooner forgive, than contempt.
Who is hardy enough to brave contempt?
It is a philosophic observation, that he who deserves an affront has no right to resent it, and he who is base enough to affront another without cause is unworthy of anything but contempt.
Don't let people disrespect you. My mom says don't open the door to the devil. Surround yourself with positive people.
Preservation of one's own culture does not require contempt or disrespect for other cultures.
If you do not respect your own wishes, no one else will. You will simply attract people who disrespect you as much as you do.
Those who disrespect you with their mouth don't deserve your ear.
Never care about people’s feelings towards you.
Disagreement is one thing; disrespect is quite another.
Disrespect for life is a direct reflection of violating the laws of the kingdom of love.
Treat people like people. Beware of pity and patronization because in them, you can't see when you're unashamedly looking down on someone.
Disrespect adheres to the ignorant; like wet leaves, breathed, on cold skin.
If I say ‘there is no God’, I disrespect your belief; how when you say ‘there is a God’ you do not disrespect mine?

Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love.
I would never disrespect any man, woman, chick, or child out there. We're all the same. What goes around comes around, and karma kicks us all in the butt at the end of the day.
Abusive language and swearing are a legacy of slavery, humiliation, and disrespect for human dignity, one’s own, and that of other people.
You have very little morally persuasive power with people who can feel your underlying contempt.
Nothing in the history of humankind has been disrespected as much as nature.
